rename.from: RFE: right click clears selected text
rename.to: RFE: right click shouldn't clear selected text

body:
>given conversations in other issues (#1539, #839) it seems right click isn't supported, which is fine.

Right **is** supported in alt-screen apps. However I feel like you're talking about some "menu" on right click which is not supported and unlikely will.

I'm not against the idea of not resetting selection on a right click, but I'm not sure how we should add it. I mean that it's a user preference and we can in theory add a config option for it, but on the other hand if the majority of terminal emulators don't reset selection on a right click we should likely do the same thing here.

It seems like VTE (Termite) does nothing on right click and both Kitty and URxvt extend the selection.

So as far as I'm concerned, not resetting the selection on right click should be fine. Though the reasoning for it 'old habits die hard', is not one I support. It would rather be for consistency with other terminals.

>It seems like VTE (Termite) does nothing on right click and both Kitty and URxvt extend the selection.

Knowing that we're going to extend selection with `Shift` + `Click` in a future like Firefox, etc, everything seems fine here for now.

URxvt does both I think, so that might be an option too if your rightclick is not used anyways.

Kitty does it just on rightclick and doesn't do anything useful on shift as far as I can tell.
I'd be all for supporting this as part of #2361. There's been some discussion about it already. I think I'm still a fan of using <kbd>shift</kbd>, but this could also be a default option.

@chrisduerr `old habits die hard` can be rephrased as unexpected/abnormal/incorrect behavior. every terminal I've personally used right click has never cleared the selection. lets try to not be pedantic.

- terminator, right click shows a context menu. closing without selecting an option maintains selection.
- urxvt, right click adjusts the selection to the click location. but otherwise selection is maintained.
- termite, right click literally does nothing. selection is maintained.

@kchibisov - I don't care about the context menu, i'm fine with right click being essential a noop.
problem is most terminals have trained people that right click doesn't change the selection in a meaningful way. so worst case is I have to move from the mouse to the keyboard after selection to copy/paste.

with alacritty a right click causes the entire selection to be deselected, meaning muscle memory causes me to lose the work I just did. so unless the current behavior can be justified it'd be better to be more similar to other terminals.

@james-lawrence The key thing here, that your initial argument on why we should change the behavior was poor, however it was discovered that all terminals we're aware of are not resetting selection on right click. So not resetting selection on right click makes sense with such argument(that literally no one is doing it).

As you can see by tags on your issue we already agreed that we're fine with merging the patch which makes right click not touching selection.

> I'd be all for supporting this as part of #2361. There's been some discussion about it already. I think I'm still a fan of using shift, but this could also be a default option.

I'm also in favor of using `shift`. For me the question would mainly be about supporting right-click too or not. But I think for now, just having one of them should be good, then we have right-click for whatever magic we might think up in the future.

@chrisduerr I'd love to support an `Action` for this is the bindings section of the config. That way users coming from urxvt (for example) can configure things to be more similar to the way they were. It's a sensible action.

issue.title: Modify Text Selection
issue.body:
Allow the user to modify a selection. This can be triggered with either a key combination or modifier + mouse button. The end point of the selection will be moved to the mouse location.

The selection will still be cleared when clicking the mouse without any modifiers activated.

Fixes: #1554

body: I'm not sure how easy it is to hook this up to an action and I'd definitely prefer just getting the feature in. But if it's just a couple of extra lines, I don't see why not.

If the action comes in a followup PR, that's totally fine. I too would like to see #2361 finished, I'd make great use of this feature.

But this shouldn't stop us from fixing this issue first either, just by making the right-click not remove the selection.

issue.title: Remove right click deselection
issue.body:
Hi everyone. I'm new to Rust programming and I decided to try to take this easy issue. So now clicking only with the right button won't deselect the text.

Apparently rustfmt removed some redundant commas from input.rs.

Fixes #3144.
